@graph.involvedParties: Dastar Corp. v. Twentieth Century Fox Film Corp.
@graph.citation: Dastar Corp. v. Twentieth Century Fox Film Corp.

@graph.reasoning: Renewed copyright on the book as the 'proprietor of copyright in a work made for hire'
Reacquired the television rights in General Eisenhower's book, including the exclusive right to distribute the Crusade television series on video and to sublicense others to do so
Decided to expand its product line from music compact discs to videos
Brought this action alleging that Dastar's sale of its Campaigns video set infringes Doubleday's copyright in General Eisenhower's book and, thus, their exclusive television rights in the book

@graph.involvedParties: Court of Appeals for the Ninth Circuit
@graph.reasoning: Affirmed the judgment for respondents on the Lanham Act claim, but reversed as to the copyright claim and remanded

@graph.involvedParties: Supreme Court of the United States
